title: MIGHT: Powerful new algorithm advances reliability of AI with applications in medical diagnostics
description: Two studies led by Johns Hopkins Kimmel Cancer Center, Ludwig Center, and Johns Hopkins Whiting School of Engineering researchers report on a powerful new method that significantly improves the reliability and accuracy of artificial intelligence (AI) for many applications. As an example, they apply the new method to early cancer detection from blood samples, known as liquid biopsy.

title: Philips CEO Jeff DiLullo on how AI is changing healthcare today
description: From faster MRI scans to earlier cancer diagnoses, Philips is betting big on artificial intelligence to transform patient care and ease the strain on clinicians.
content: AI is quietly reshaping the efficiency, power, and potential of U.S. healthcare, even as government health policy and spending drastically shift. Philips, the legacy electronics manufacturer turned medtech provider, is leading the AI healthcare revol... [6571 chars]

title: Why AI is an industrial relations challenge for business
description: Australia will miss the productivity gains from artificial intelligence unless we fix the laws that stop firms from reorganising how work gets done.
content: For years, we have been told that our productivity problem can be solved by taxing landlords, lifting the GST, or reining in big business. The latest hope is that AI will be the breakthrough. But AI will not transform the economy simply by existing. ... [675 chars]

title: The age of AI soft power
description: Artificial intelligence leaders like OpenAI and DeepMind see themselves as being in a race to build artificial general intelligence: a model capable of performing any intellectual task that a human can. title: Sentient Dynamics Token (SDT) Launches on RealSimple Crypto Exchange (RSCX): Pioneering a New Era of Quantum Computing and AI Integration

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns of AI bubble, says investors are 'overexcited': report
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said he thinks the artificial intelligence market is in a bubble – comparable to the dot-com crash of the early 2000s, according to a report.
content:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warned that the billions of dollars being plowed into the artificial intelligence arms race risks causing a bubble comparable to the dot-com crash of the early 2000s.
